dt: {bc}a hard usually inorganic mass (such as a bezoar or tophus) formed in a living body
{bc}a mass of mineral matter found generally in rock of a composition different from its own and produced by deposition from aqueous solution in the rock
{bc}the act or process of {a_link|concreting} {bc}the state of being concreted

et: borrowed from Latin {it}concrētiōn-, concrētiō{/it} "formation into something solid," from {it}concrē-,{/it} stem of {it}concrēscere{/it} "to coalesce, condense, solidify, harden" + {it}-tiōn-,-tiō,{/it} suffix of verbal action {ma}{mat|concrescence|}{/ma}
shortdef: a hard usually inorganic mass (such as a bezoar or tophus) formed in a living body
a mass of mineral matter found generally in rock of a composition different from its own and produced by deposition from aqueous solution in the rock
